abstract: The F.D.I.C. has approved a draft, but other federal agencies must still vote on the proposal, which will be open for public comment until January.
snippet: The F.D.I.C. has approved a draft, but other federal agencies must still vote on the proposal, which will be open for public comment until January.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: Federal regulators on Tuesday took a much-anticipated step toward reining in risky trading on Wall Street, introducing a proposal that would prohibit federally insured banks from making certain types of bets with their own money.
